flow.descriptionCdata:
8fef6766-3232-4e03-a21d-4e83ce58dc59.26530647-9e50-4f93-bc8a-929e245835e1.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
8fef6766-3232-4e03-a21d-4e83ce58dc59.54f49966-9a66-41a8-b31e-56ba1f79b781.description=
Increases the size of a hard disk on a virtual machine.

Inputs\:
    host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
    user - VMWare username.
    password - VMWare user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
Examples\: 443, 80
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"
    closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    async - Asynchronously perform the task.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
Default value\: 800
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
    vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter
    diskSize - The size of the disk for a virtual machine in GB. If it is less than the current disk size, the operation will complete succesfully, but the disk size will remain unmodified.
    deviceNumber - The virtual disk number on the VM.  As an example\: "Hard disk 1" would be deviceNumber "1". This input and 'uuid' are mutually exclusive.
    uuid - Universally unique identifier (uuid) of the disk. This input and 'deviceNumber' are mutually exclusive.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Task result or operation result. Reason for error on failure.
8fef6766-3232-4e03-a21d-4e83ce58dc59.6492f3d1-f316-45d9-8d37-3511ceb8534f.description=
This operation executes a command from the command line of a remote RAS. 
When running on Unix, you cannot determine the type of shell to be used (sh, bash, ksh, csh, etc), so make sure to include the shell in your command if you want to perform operations such as file redirection.  
Example\: sh -c "ls -lha /etc > /tmp/myfile".

When running on Windows, this command  prepends "cmd.exe /C" or "command.exe /C" to the command you specify, so there is no need to pass this information to the operation.

Inputs\:
    command - The command to execute.
    arguments - Any arguments needed for the command.
    environment - Specifies environment variables/values that need to be defined when running the command.
    path - The path to the commands executable.
    cmd_timeout - Timeout in milliseconds before the command is considered as having failed when "returnImmediately" is false.
Default value\: 100000 (100 seconds).
    returnImmediately - If "true", the operation executes the command and returns a result immediately.  It does not wait for the command to finish.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: false.

Results\:
    STDOUT - The standard output of the command.
    STDERR - The standard error output of the command.
    exitStatus - Every command returns an exit status (sometimes referred to as a return status or exit code). A successful command returns 0, while an unsuccessful one returns a non-zero value that usually can be interpreted as an error code.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.


Example\:
   This is a valid input example for executing a "ping" command from a Windows machine\:
    command\: ping
    arguments\: example.server.com


8fef6766-3232-4e03-a21d-4e83ce58dc59.73b70282-21e2-4a5e-87ca-5d20a2023c2a.description=
Sets the number of CPUs for a virtual machine.  Virtual machine cannot be in a suspended power state.  CPU hot plug is supported if enabled for the virtual machine.

Inputs\:
   host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
   user - VMWare username.
   password - VMWare user's password.
   port - Port to connect on.
   protocol - Connection protocol. Valid values\: http, https.
   closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation. Valid values\:true, false.
   async - Asynchronously perform the task. Valid values\: true, false.
   taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
   virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
   vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type. Valid values\:inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid.
   vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
   vmCpuCount - New number of CPUs for the virtual machine.

Responses\:
   success - If async is true the task was successfuly queued.  If async is false the CPU count for the virtual machine was successfully set.
   failure - Something went wrong.  See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
   returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
   1. Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
   2. CPU limits\: The maximum value for 'vmCpuCount' is based on the virtual hardware version of the virtual machine. Limits are as follows\:
       Virtual hardware 11 (vSphere 6.0)\: 128
       Virtual hardware 10 (vSphere 5.5)\: 64
       Virtual hardware 9 (vSphere 5.1)\: 64
       Virtual hardware 8 (vSphere 5.0)\: 32
       Virtual hardware 7 (vSphere 4)\: 8
       Virtual hardware 4 (ESX 3.x)\: 4
       Virtual hardware 3 (ESX 2.5)\: 2
       For more details regarding configuration maximums and virtual machine compatibility settings see http\://pubs.vmware.com/vsphere-60/index.jsp\#com.vmware.vsphere.vm_admin.doc/GUID-789C3913-1053-4850-A0F0-E29C3D32B6DA.html
   3. The number of CPUs specified in the 'vmCpuCount' must not exceed the number of CPUs available on the ESX/ESXi host on which the Virtual Machine will run. When the specified value is greater than the number of CPUs available and below the configuration maximums the number of CPUs will be set to that value for the specified virtual machine however the virtual machine will not be usable. 


8fef6766-3232-4e03-a21d-4e83ce58dc59.dcf4a0b1-5361-4c06-9841-bc9ebd10c913.description=
This operation executes a command from the command line of a remote RAS. 
When running on Unix, you cannot determine the type of shell to be used (sh, bash, ksh, csh, etc), so make sure to include the shell in your command if you want to perform operations such as file redirection.  
Example\: sh -c "ls -lha /etc > /tmp/myfile".

When running on Windows, this command  prepends "cmd.exe /C" or "command.exe /C" to the command you specify, so there is no need to pass this information to the operation.

Inputs\:
    command - The command to execute.
    arguments - Any arguments needed for the command.
    environment - Specifies environment variables/values that need to be defined when running the command.
    path - The path to the commands executable.
    cmd_timeout - Timeout in milliseconds before the command is considered as having failed when "returnImmediately" is false.
Default value\: 100000 (100 seconds).
    returnImmediately - If "true", the operation executes the command and returns a result immediately.  It does not wait for the command to finish.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: false.

Results\:
    STDOUT - The standard output of the command.
    STDERR - The standard error output of the command.
    exitStatus - Every command returns an exit status (sometimes referred to as a return status or exit code). A successful command returns 0, while an unsuccessful one returns a non-zero value that usually can be interpreted as an error code.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.


Example\:
   This is a valid input example for executing a "ping" command from a Windows machine\:
    command\: ping
    arguments\: example.server.com


8fef6766-3232-4e03-a21d-4e83ce58dc59.fd6fa8fb-1e97-4358-8ceb-974b7f03a6da.description=
Sets the memory size for a virtual machine. Virtual machine cannot be in a suspended power state.  Memory hot add is supported if enabled for the virtual machine.

Inputs\:
   host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
   user - VMWare username.
   password - VMWare user's password.
   port - Port to connect on.
   protocol - Connection protocol. Valid values\: http, https.
   closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation. Valid values\: true, false.
   async - Asynchronously perform the task. Valid values\: true, false.
   taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
   virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
   vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type. Valid values\: inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid.
   vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
   vmMemorySize - New memory size for the virtual machine in megabytes.  This number must be a multiple of 4.

Responses\:
   success - If async is true the task was successfuly queued.  If async is false the memory size for the virtual machine was successfully set.
   failure - Something went wrong.  See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
   returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
   1. Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
   2. Memory limits\: The maximum value for 'vmMemorySize' is based on the virtual hardware version of the virtual machine. Limits are as follows\:
      Virtual hardware 11 (vSphere 6.0)\: 4177920 
      Virtual hardware 10 (vSphere 5.5)\: 1035264 
      Virtual hardware 9 (vSphere 5.1)\: 1035264 
      Virtual hardware 8 (vSphere 5.0)\:  1035264 
      Virtual hardware 7 (vSphere 4)\: 261120 
      Virtual hardware 4 (ESX 3.x)\: 65536 
      Virtual hardware 3 (ESX 2.5)\: 3600 
      For more details regarding configuration maximums and virtual machine compatibility settings see http\://pubs.vmware.com/vsphere-60/index.jsp\#com.vmware.vsphere.vm_admin.doc/GUID-789C3913-1053-4850-A0F0-E29C3D32B6DA.html
flow.name: upFlavorServer

step.name: String Comparator Is it possible to grow or decrease?
